business.headline: NSE CEO Ashish Chauhan warns retail investors against derivatives tradingNSE chief Ashish Chauhan also advised investors not to believe market tips and discussions on social media platforms.

Old vs new tax regime: Which one should you opt for in 2025-26?While the old tax regime promotes savings through tax benefits, the new one is simpler, involves less paperwork and reduces the chances of tax fraud.

Old vs new income tax regime: What to choose if you earn Rs 50 lakh per yearTaxpayers should consider a few key factors before making a choice. The old regime allows deductions, whereas the new regime offers lower tax rates but no major deductions.
Sensex closes over 500 points, Nifty above 23,300; NTPC gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 557.45 points to end at 76,905.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 159.75 points to close at 23,350.40.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Smallcap, midcap stocks gain momentum. Good news for mutual funds too?Given the correction, some analysts have indicated that quality smallcap and midcap stocks could start regaining some momentum. But does this apply to smallcap and midcap mutual funds too?

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Morgan Stanley to layoff 2,000 employees to boost efficiencySeveral renowned banks have been reducing their workforce recently as they brace for economic uncertainty following President Donald Trump's newly announced trade tariffs.

Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu and Rajamouli join tree plantation drive in Odisha. PicsIn a bid to promote environmental awareness, actor Mahesh Babu and film-maker SS Rajamouli joined hands for a tree-planting initiative in Odisha. Unseen photos of the event have now taken the internet by storm.

Prithviraj says Empuraan 'not Rs 100 crore film where Rs 80 crore goes to salaries'Prithviraj Sukumaran ensured L2: Empuraan's budget was spent on filmmaking, not salaries. Neither he nor Mohanlal charged a fee. He also revealed Akshay Kumar worked for free on Selfiee.

No regrets: Jugal Hansraj on career setbacks, typecasting and new beginningsJugal Hansraj was praised for his performance in Nadaaniyan. In an exclusive interview with us, he shared insights on Bollywood's evolution, his career struggles, and overcoming typecasting.

Anirudh Ravichander confirms performing at CSK vs MI match with fun cryptic postAnirudh Ravichander confirmed performing at the CSK vs MI match on Sunday in Chennai's Chepauk stadium. The music composer and singer shared a fun cryptic post on March 22.

Mahira Sharma shuts down dating rumours with cricketer Mohammed SirajMahira Sharma has addressed rumours of a romantic relationship with cricketer Mohammed Siraj. Both have issued statements debunking the claims, urging an end to such speculations.

Avneet Kaur once beat up a boy with bat for misbehaving on Holi: He deserved itAvneet Kaur recalled beating up a boy for misbehaving with her on Holi, being bullied at school, and facing misconceptions about her attitude. She is gearing up for the release of Love in Vietnam, India-Vietnam's first film collaboration.

Tamannaah Bhatia's Odela 2 locks April release, actors shares striking new posterTamannaah Bhatia's much-awaited film Odela 2 is set to release in April. The actor announced the release date with a new poster on March 22.

Randeep Hooda shot Veer Savarkar with fractured knee, admits being 'hangry' on setActor Randeep Hooda revealed that he shot Swatantrya Veer Savarkar despite having a fractured knee. In a heartfelt post marking the film's first anniversary, he opened up about the intense physical pain he endured during the shoot.

Prithviraj Sukumaran admits nepotism advantage: My surname got me my first filmActor Prithviraj Sukumaran openly admitted that his entry into the film industry was facilitated by nepotism. The actor acknowledged that his first role was secured due to his surname's influence.

SRK motivates KKR players before IPL 2025 opener: Be happy, be healthyShah Rukh Khan gave a pep talk to KKR ahead of their IPL 2025 opener, urging players to stay happy and healthy. He will open the grand ceremony at Eden Gardens before performances by Shreya Ghoshal, Karan Aujla, and Disha Patani.

Sunny Deol's Jaat trailer release postponed, makers to announce new date soonThe trailer of Sunny Deol's Jaat was initially scheduled for release on March 22. However, on Saturday, the makers announced that it has been postponed, with a new release date to be revealed soon.

Ali Sethi's Pasoori is a global hit, but his mother doesn't like itPakistani singer Ali Sethi's Pasoori may be a global hit, but his mother, Jugnoo Mohsin, isn't a fan. She prefers his traditional Punjabi songs and told him so, despite the track's popularity among music lovers.

Aamir Khan on Laal Singh Chaddha failure: I ran a lot, the film didn'tAamir Khan humorously addresses the failure of his last film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in a light-hearted video where he guesses badly described plots of his movies.

Akshay Kumar confirms Kesari 2 release date, hints at a story of revolutionAkshay Kumar confirms Kesari 2. The film is set to release on April 18. The sequel may explore the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. It also stars R Madhavan and Ananya Panday.

Ranveer Singh brings Rocky Randhawa's energy to wedding bash. WatchRanveer Singh's dance videos from a wedding went viral as he grooved to his hit songs. He was seen in his rugged Dhurandhar look as he enjoyed the celebrations.

Adolescence ending explained: Truth of Katie's death, and that devastating finaleAdolescence ends right where it starts - inside Jamie Miller's room. The Netflix series gives you a heart-breaking finale, where no one, neither you nor Jamie's parents, have anything to say but feel. Don't read ahead if you haven't watched the show already!

Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi's Jolly LLB 3 gets release dateAkshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi's Jolly LLB 3 will release in September 2025. Directed by Subhash Kapoor, the film also stars Saurabh Shukla and Huma Qureshi.

'Kitne aadmi the?' Not enough to remember today's films byBollywood's golden era gave us iconic dialogues, music, and moments. Today, films have become forgettable and do not have a lasting impact. Experts blame weak writing, fleeting music, and OTT overload for cinema's declining recall value.

Abhishek Bachchan says Aishwarya Rai's 'I want to talk' calls make him nervousAbhishek Bachchan joked about "I want to talk" calls from Aishwarya Rai stressing him out. The couple has been married for 17 years now.

general news.headline: MK Stalin-led panel passes resolution, seeks delimitation freeze for 25 more yearsThe Joint Action Committee (JAC) on delimitation, led by Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin, adopted a resolution demanding transparency in the delimitation process. The JAC urged the Union Government to extend the freeze on parliamentary constituencies based on the 1971 Census for another 25 years.

Samajwadi MP calls Rajput king Rana Sanga 'traitor'; BJP says shame on youSamajwadi Party leader Ramji Lal Suman's remark in Parliament, calling Rajput king Rana Sanga a "traitor", ignited a political storm. BJP leaders denounced the statement as an insult to Rajputs and India's history, demanding an apology from the party.

Stabbed in heart, limbs cut off to fit in drum: Autopsy of UP man killed by wifeSaurabh Rajput was allegedly drugged and murdered on March 4. His wife and her lover then hid his body in a cement-filled drum before they left for a vacation.
NSE CEO Ashish Chauhan warns retail investors against derivatives tradingNSE chief Ashish Chauhan also advised investors not to believe market tips and discussions on social media platforms.

Kerala leads the way on public safety, but stray dog menace bites: GDB surveyKerala's public safety measures may be a howling success, but 96% of Kerala residents oppose the presence of stray dogs, shows India Today's Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey.

Trump told Sunita Williams will get just Rs 430 per day for overtime. He reactsSunita Williams and Butch Wilmore spent an additional 278 days in space after their week-long mission in June last year turned into a nine-month ordeal. Here is how much they will get in overtime pay.

KKR vs RCB, Kolkata pitch, weather report: Washout or thriller on cards? Live UpdatesKolkata (KKR) vs Bengaluru (RCB) Match Pitch Report, Weather forecast: The stage is set for the grand opener of IPL 2025 between Kolkata and Bengaluru. Will the Eden Gardens pitch have the ingredients in it for a thriller and, most importantly, will the weather in Kolkata on Saturday, March 22 be kind to the fans?

BJP MP's 'mischievous' post on Shashi Tharoor: Travelling in same directionJay Panda, who is the BJP vice president, said they were 'finally travelling in the same direction', drawing a swift clarification from Shashi Tharoor.

Should alcohol be banned? This is what India has to saySome states in India have tried to ban the sale of alcohol and are seeing mixed results. Though a complete ban never succeeds, India Today's inaugural Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey found 82 per cent of the respondents supported prohibition.

UK artist with bipolar disorder seeks euthanasia, but not before a 'last supper'On 9 December 2024, Joseph Awuah-Darko, a British-Ghanaian artist, took to Instagram to announce his wish to pursue euthanasia.

Tejashwi Yadav attends iftar after temple visit, BJP takes 'topi over tika' jabOn Friday, Tejashwi visited a temple before attending an Iftar event. Bihar minister Sanjay Saraogi alleged that Tejashwi Yadav 'hates Sanatan Dharma' and should convert his religion.
Swami Gaur Gopal Das on the 70-hour work-week debate: It's about balanceDuring his session at BT MindRush 2025, Swami Gaur Gopal Das weighed in on the 70-hour work-week debate.

12-year-old builds nuclear fusion reactor, gets visit from FBIJackson Oswalt, a 12-year-old teen from Memphis, US, built a nuclear fusion reactor in his bedroom and made a Guinness World Record for the youngest person to achieve fusion. Later on, he got a visit from the FBI to make sure all was good.

Lebanon warns of 'new war' after Israel retaliates with heavy airstrikesThe fresh escalation, which has again brought the Middle East to a boil, came after rockets were launched from Lebanon towards northern Israel.

Meerut woman partied in Kasol, Manali with lover days after husband's murderAfter murdering her 29-year-old husband, Saurabh Rajput, Muskan Rastogi and her boyfriend, Sahil Shukla, both 27, checked into Hotel Purnima in Kasol on March 10. They were in Manali before arriving in Kasol in a taxi.

Elon Musk reacts to his AI chatbot Grok's Hindi slang controversy in IndiaSharing a BBC article titled "Why Elon Musk's Grok is kicking up a storm in India," the tech magnate reacted with a laughing-out-loud emoji. His post garnered millions of views within a few hours.

IPL turns 18: Vintage vibe, new tribe, same hypeThe IPL turns 18, blending nostalgia with fresh energy. While a new generation steps up, OGs like MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli, and Rohit Sharma still dominate the headlines. The excitement remains unchanged, but with new captains and evolving narratives, the league continues to reinvent itself.

Ceasefire up in flames: Netanyahu's Gaza strategy and its uncertain endgameUS President Donald Trump warned of "all hell breaking out" in the Middle East if hostages weren't freed before he took office. A brief ceasefire averted the crisis, but Israel resumed strikes on March 18.

Aston Martin Vanquish launched in India, price starts at Rs 8.85 croreThe Vanquish returns with a 5.2L Twin-Turbo V12, producing 835PS and 1000Nm torque. It's Aston Martin's fastest series production car, hitting 214mph (345kmph) and 0-100 km/h in 3.3 seconds.

Supriya Sule blasts Air India over delays: Unacceptable, we pay premium faresTagging Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu in her post on X, she criticised the airline's "continuous trend of delays," calling it "unacceptable."

Madhya Pradesh woman returns alive 18 months after 4 jailed for her 'murder'According to Lalita's father, the family had identified a mutilated body based on physical markings, including a tattoo on the hand and a black thread tied around the leg. Convinced that it was Lalita, the family performed the last rites.
Yash's Toxic confirmed for March 2026 releaseKannada superstar Yash's highly anticipated film Toxic has officially set its release date. The film is scheduled to hit the silver screen in March 2026.

We are moments away from the beginning of the opening ceremony featuring many big stars.

Heather Knight resigns as England undergo big overhaul after Ashes debacleEngland captain Heather Knight has stepped down from his position a day after head coach Jon Lewis put down his papers as the head coach. England recently lost the Ashes 0-16 to Australia.

Phil Salt excited to open with 'super competitor' Virat Kohli in IPL 2025England and Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Phil Salt opened up on his camaraderie with Virat Kohli ahead of their opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

Women's ODI World Cup likely in September, Guwahati set for historic Test matchIndia is set to host the Women's ODI World Cup tentatively in September. According to BCCI sources, the opening match and opening ceremony will be held in Vizag.

If RCB don't do well, will see where captain Patidar stands: HarbhajanHarbhajan Singh believes Rajat Patidar's captaincy future at Royal Challengers Bengaluru could be in doubt if the team fails to deliver in IPL 2025. The former India spinner feels the expectations will be immense on Patidar as he leads RCB in their pursuit of a maiden title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
